predicate.note: Frames file for 'rhyme' based on sentences in wsj. No access to Verbnet at the moment.

example.name: agentive
example.text: With loving detail she recalls her Uncle Gabe, an Orthodox Jew and song lyricist (who [*T*-1] rhymed river with liver in a love song); and Uncle Len, a mysterious part-time investigator who looked like Lincoln and carried a change of clothing in a Manila envelope, like an ``undercover President on a good-will mission.''
example.arg: [*T*-1] -> who -> an Orthodox Jew and song lyricist

example.name: unaccusative
example.text: Trouble with a capital T and that rhymes with P and that stands for pool.

example.name: merged args
example.note: They do in some dialects of American English. Not mine.
